Description: Conical vessel of straw tempered Nile silt pottery with flat base and direct rim, coated with a thick red slip and burnished on the exterior. There is a large blacked area on one side which is an accident of firing in the kiln.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Shape and fabric like Rough ware R82 in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery.
Condition: fair (reconstructed); Salt damage to surface, heavily restored with gap fill.
